questions.description: Which of the following is not a general characteristic of equilibria involving physical processes

options.description: Equilibrium is possible only in a closed system at a given temperature
All measurable properties of the system remain constant
All the physical processes stop at equilibrium
The opposing processes occur at the same rate and these is dynamic but stable condition.

questions.description: A small amount of acetone is taken in a watch glass and it is kept open in atmosphere. Which statement is correct for the given experiment?

options.description: The rate of condensation from vapor to liquid state is higher than the rate of evaporation
The rate of condensation form vapour to liquid state is equal to the rate of evaporation
The rate of condensation from vapour to liquid state is much less than the rate of evaporation
The rate of condensation form vapour to liquid state is equal or less than the rate of evaporation

questions.description: A reaction is said to be in equilibrium when

options.description: the rate of transformation of reactant to products is equal to the rate of transformation of products to the reactants
50% of the reactants are converted to products.
the reactants is near completion and all the reactants are converted to products.
the volume of reactants is just equal to the volume of the products.

questions.description: Which of the following is not true about a reversible reaction?

options.description: The reaction does not proceed to completion
It cannot be influenced by a catalyst
Number of moles of reactants and products is always equal
It can be attained only in a closed container

questions.description: If a system is at equilibrium the rate of forward to the reversible reaction is:
If the synthesis of ammonia form Haber's process is carried out with exactly the same starting conditions (of partial pressure and temperature) but using D₂ (deuterium) in place of H₂. Then

options.description: the composition of reaction mixture will remain same at equilibrium.
Use of isotope in reaction will not produce ammonia.
At equilibrium rate of forward reaction will be greater than the rate of reverse reaction

options.description: predict the extent of a reaction on the basis of its magnitude
predict the direction of the reaction

questions.description:
If for the reaction 
N₂ + 3H₂ ⇌ 2NH₃, △H = -92.38 KJ/MOL then what happens if the temperature is increased?

options.description: No effect on the formation products

questions.description: The equilibrium which remains unaffected by pressure change is
Which of the following information can be obtained on the basis of Le Chatelier principle?

options.description: Dissociation constant of a weak acid
Equilibrium constant of a chemical reaction
Shift in equilibrium position on changing value of a constraint

questions.description: According to Le-chatelier's principle adding heat to solid ⇌ liquid equilibrium will cause the
Suitable conditions for melting of ice
Which of the following reaction will be favoured at low pressure?
In weak electrolytes, equilibrium is established between ions and the unionized molecules. This type of equilibrium

options.description: is due to complete ionization of electrolyte

questions.description: A base as defined by Bronsted theory is a substance which can
Which of the following molecules acts as a Lewis acid?
Which one of the following is the correct statement?

options.description: HCO₃¯ is the conjugate base of CO₃²¯
NH₂¯ is the conjugate acid of NH₃
H₂SO₄ is the conjugate acid of HSO₄¯
NH₃ is the conjugate base base of NH₂¯

questions.description: Among boron trifluoride, stannic chloride and stannous chloride, Lewis acid is represented by
An acid/base dissociation equilibrium is dynamic involving a transfer of proton in forward and reverse directions. now with passage of time in which direction equilibrium is favoured?

options.description: in the direction of stronger base and stronger acid
in the direction of formation of stronger base and weaker acid
in the direction of formation of weaker base and weaker acid
in the direction of formation of weaker base and strong acid

questions.description: In HS¯, I¯, RNH₂ and NH₃ order of proton accepting tendency will be
Conjugate acid of NH₂¯ is
The value of the ionic product of water

options.description: change by adding acid or alkali

options.description: to increase the concentration of NH₄⁺ ions
to increase the concentration of Cl¯ ions
to reduce the concentration of OH¯ ions
to increase the concentration of OH¯ ions

questions.description: The solubility of AgI in NaI solution is less than that in pure water because

options.description: the temperature of the solution decreases
solubility product to AgI is less than that of NaI

questions.description: Which of the following statements about pH and H⁺ ion concentration is incorrect?

options.description: Addition of one drop of concentrated HCl in NH₄ OH solution decreases pH of the solution
A solution of the mixture of one equivalent of each of CH₃COOH and NaOH has a pH of 7
PH of pure neutral water is not zero
A cold and concentrated H₂SO₄ has lower H⁺ ion concentration than a dilute solution of H₂SO₄

acids and alkalies in these solution are shielded form attack by other ions

they have fixed value of pH
